meanings.definition: A situation in which a liquid boils over the edge of a container.
meanings.sent1: The pot's boilovers made a mess on the stove.
meanings.sent2: I had to clean up the boilovers from the pasta pot.
meanings.sent3: The boilovers in the kitchen caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like boilovers, spilling out uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The boilovers were so frequent, I had to watch the pot constantly.

meanings.definition: A surprising or unexpected result or outcome.
meanings.sent1: The game's boilovers left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent2: The financial report had some unexpected boilovers.
meanings.sent3: The party's boilovers turned it into a memorable event.
meanings.sent4: The meeting ended with emotional boilovers among the team.
meanings.sent5: The boilovers of the experiment amazed the scientists.
